protocol.name: startproto
protocol.longname: Starting Protocol (used for beginning the parsing)

protocol.name: ethernet
protocol.comment: Ethernet DIX has been included in 802.3

default.show: Error in Token Ring Attention code lookup

field.name: host_total_num_acl_data_packets
field.longname: Total Number of ACL Data Packets

field.name: host_total_num_sco_data_packets
field.longname: Total Number of SCO Data Packets

case.show: Local device will be a master and will not accept a master slave role switch by a remote device

field.name: num_response
field.longname: Number of Responses from the Inquiry

case.show: Change Connection Link Key Complete Event

field.name: hops
field.description: Client sets to zero, optionally used by relay agents when booting via a relay agent

field.name: xid
field.description: a random number chosen by the client, used by the client and server to associate messages and responses between a client and a server

field.name: secs
field.description: Filled in by client, seconds elapsed since client began address acquisition or renewal process

field.name: MBZ
field.description: MUST BE ZERO (reserved for future use)

field.name: ciaddr
field.description: Client IP address; only filled in if client is in BOUND, RENEW or REBINDING state and can respond to ARP requests

field.name: siaddr
field.longname: IP of next server to use in bootstrap
field.description: IP address of next server to use in bootstrap; returned in DHCPOFFER, DHCPACK by server

field.name: giaddr
field.description: Relay agent IP address, used in booting via a relay agent.

field.name: sname
field.description: Optional server host name, null terminated string

field.name: file
field.description: Boot file name, null terminated string; 'generic' name or null in DHCPDISCOVER, fully qualified directory-path name in DHCPOFFER

field.name: magic
field.description: This field defines how has to be interpreted next section; the value 0x63825363 ahs been standardized as 'vendor independent' and it is the mostly used value.

field.name: hops
field.description: Client sets to zero, optionally used by relay agents when booting via a relay agent

field.name: xid
field.description: a random number chosen by the client, used by the client and server to associate messages and responses between a client and a server

field.name: secs
field.description: Filled in by client, seconds elapsed since client began address acquisition or renewal process

field.name: MBZ
field.description: MUST BE ZERO (reserved for future use)

field.name: ciaddr
field.description: Client IP address; only filled in if client is in BOUND, RENEW or REBINDING state and can respond to ARP requests

field.name: siaddr
field.longname: IP of next server to use in bootstrap
field.description: IP address of next server to use in bootstrap; returned in DHCPOFFER, DHCPACK by server

field.name: giaddr
field.description: Relay agent IP address, used in booting via a relay agent

field.name: chaddr
field.comment: The sum of the size of this field and the next one MUST be 16 bytes

field.name: chaddr_realign
field.comment: The sum of the size of this field and the previous one MUST be 16 bytes

field.name: sname
field.description: Optional server host name, null terminated string

field.name: file
field.description: Boot file name, null terminated string; 'generic' name or null in DHCPDISCOVER, fully qualified directory-path name in DHCPOFFER

field.name: padding
field.description: Padding must be a sequence of 0

block.name: pad_option
block.description: Pad to align

block.name: end_option
block.description: The end option marks the end of valid information in the vendor field

block.name: subnet_option
block.description: The subnet mask option specifies the client's subnet mask as per RFC 950

block.name: time_option
block.description: The subnet mask option specifies the client's subnet mask as per RFC 950

block.name: router_option
block.description: The router option specifies a list of IP addresses for routers on the client's subnet. Routers SHOULD be listed in order of preference

block.name: time_server_option
block.description: The time server option specifies a list of RFC 868 time servers available to the client

block.name: name_server_option
block.description: The name server option specifies a list of IEN 116 name servers available to the client

block.name: domain_name_server_option
block.description: The domain name server option specifies a list of Domain Name System (STD 13, RFC 1035) name servers available to the client

block.name: log_server_option
block.description: The log server option specifies a list of MIT-LCS UDP log servers available to the client

block.name: cookie_server_option
block.description: The cookie server option specifies a list of RFC 865 cookie servers available to the client

block.name: lpr_server_option
block.description: The LPR server option specifies a list of RFC 1179 line printer servers available to the client

block.name: impress_server_option
block.description: The Impress server option specifies a list of Imagen Impress servers available to the client

block.name: resource_location_server_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of RFC 887 Resource Location servers available to the client

block.name: host_name_option
block.description: This option specifies the name of the client

block.name: boot_file_size_option
block.description: This option specifies the length in 512-octet blocks of the default boot image for the client

block.name: merit_dump_file_option
block.description: This option specifies the path-name of a file to which the client's core image should be dumped in the event the client crashes

field.name: dump
field.description: The path is formatted as a character string consisting of characters from the NVT ASCII character set

block.name: domain_name_option
block.description: This option specifies the domain name that client should use when resolving hostnames via the Domain Name System

block.name: swap_server_option
block.description: This specifies the IP address of the client's swap server

field.name: address
field.description: IP address of the client's swap server

block.name: root_path_option
block.description: This option specifies the path-name that contains the client's root disk

field.name: pathname
field.description: The path is formatted as a character string consisting of characters from the NVT ASCII character set

block.name: extensions_path_option
block.description: A string to specify a file, retrievable via TFTP

block.name: ip_forwading_option
block.description: This option specifies whether the client should configure its IP layer for packet forwarding

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 means disable IP forwarding, and a value of 1 means enable IP forwarding

block.name: non_local_source_routing_option
block.description: This option specifies whether the client should configure its IP layer to allow forwarding of datagrams with non-local source routes

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 means disallow forwarding of such datagrams, and a value of 1 means allow forwarding

block.name: policy_filter_option
block.description: This option specifies policy filters for non-local source routing

block.name: maximum_datagram_reassembly_size_option
block.description: This option specifies the maximum size datagram that the client should be prepared to reassemble

field.name: size
field.description: The size is specified as a 16-bit unsigned integer. The minimum value legal value is 576

block.name: default_ip_ttl_option
block.description: This option specifies the default time-to-live that the client should use on outgoing datagrams

field.name: ttl
field.description: The TTL is specified as an octet with a value between 1 and 255

block.name: path_mtu_aging_timeout_option
block.description: This option specifies the timeout (in seconds) to use when aging Path MTU values discovered by the mechanism defined in RFC 1191

field.name: ttl
field.description: The timeout is specified as a 32-bit unsigned integer

block.name: path_mtu_plateau_table_option
block.description: This option specifies a table of MTU sizes to use when performing Path MTU Discovery as defined in RFC 1191

block.name: interface_mtu_option
block.description: This option specifies the MTU to use on this interface

field.name: mtu
field.description: The minimum legal value for the MTU is 68

block.name: all_subnets_are_local_option
block.description: This option specifies whether or not the client may assume that all subnets of the IP network to which the client is connected use the same MTU as the subnet of that network to which the client is directly connected

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 1 indicates that all subnets share the same MTU. A value of 0 means that the client should assume that some subnets of the directly connected network may have smaller MTUs

block.name: broadcast_address_option
block.description: This option specifies the broadcast address in use on the client's subnet

block.name: perform_mask_discovery_option
block.description: This option specifies whether or not the client should perform subnet mask discovery using ICMP

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 indicates that the client should not perform mask discovery. A value of 1 means that the client should perform mask discovery

block.name: mask_supplier_option
block.description: This option specifies whether or not the client should respond to subnet mask requests using ICMP

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 indicates that the client should not respond. A value of 1 means that the client should respond

block.name: perform_router_discovery_option
block.description: This option specifies whether or not the client should solicit routers using the Router Discovery mechanism defined in RFC 1256

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 indicates that the client should not perform router discovery. A value of 1 means that the client should perform router discovery

block.name: router_solicitation_address_option
block.description: This option specifies the address to which the client should transmit router solicitation requests

block.name: static_route_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of static routes that the client should install in its routing cache

block.name: trailer_encapsulation_option
block.description: This option specifies whether or not the client should negotiate the use of trailers (RFC 893) when using the ARP protocol

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 indicates that the client should not attempt to use trailers. A value of 1 means that the client should attempt to use trailers

block.name: arp_cache_timeout_option
block.description: This option specifies the timeout in seconds for ARP cache entries

block.name: ethernet_encapsulation_option
block.description: This option specifies whether or not the client should use Ethernet Version 2 (RFC 894) or IEEE 802.3 (RFC 1042) encapsulation if the interface is an Ethernet

field.name: value
field.description: A value of 0 indicates that the client should use RFC 894 encapsulation. A value of 1 means that the client should use RFC 1042 encapsulation

block.name: tcp_default_ttl_option
block.description: This option specifies the default TTL that the client should use when sending TCP segments

field.name: ttl
field.description: Time To Live. The minimum value is 1

block.name: tcp_keepalive_interval_option
block.description: This option specifies the interval (in seconds) that the client TCP should wait before sending a keepalive message on a TCP connection

field.name: time
field.description: A value of zero indicates that the client should not generate keepalive messages on connections unless specifically requested by an application

block.name: tcp_keepalive_garbage_option
block.description: This option specifies the whether or not the client should send TCP keepalive messages with a octet of garbage for compatibility with older implementations

block.name: network_information_service_domain_option
block.description: This option specifies the name of the client's NIS domain

field.name: nisdn
field.description: The domain is formatted as a character string consisting of characters from the NVT ASCII character set

block.name: network_information_servers_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of IP addresses indicating NIS servers available to the client

block.name: nis_list
block.description: Servers SHOULD be listed in order of preference

block.name: network_time_protocol_servers_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of IP addresses indicating NTP servers available to the client

block.name: ntp_list
block.description: Servers SHOULD be listed in order of preference

block.name: vendor_specific_information_option
block.description: This option is used by clients and servers to exchange vendor-specific information

block.name: netbios_ns_option
block.longname: NetBIOS over TCP/IP Name Server Option
block.description: The NetBIOS name server (NBNS) option specifies a list of RFC 1001/1002 NBNS name servers listed in order of preference

block.name: netbios_dds_option
block.longname: NetBIOS over TCP/IP Datagram Distribution Server Option
block.description: The NetBIOS datagram distribution server (NBDD) option specifies a list of RFC 1001/1002 NBDD servers listed in order of preference

block.name: netbios_node_type_option
block.longname: NetBIOS over TCP/IP Node Type Option
block.description: The NetBIOS node type option allows NetBIOS over TCP/IP clients which are configurable to be configured as described in RFC 1001/1002

block.name: netbios_scope_option
block.description: The NetBIOS scope option specifies the NetBIOS over TCP/IP scope parameter for the client as specified in RFC 1001/1002

block.name: xwindows_system_font_server_option
block.longname: X Window System Font Server Option
block.description: This option specifies a list of X Window System Font servers available to the client

block.name: x_window_system_display_manager_option
block.longname: X Window System Display Manager Option
block.description: This option specifies a list of IP addresses of systems that are running the X Window System Display Manager and are available to the client

block.name: network_information_service_domain_option
block.description: This option specifies the name of the client's NIS+ domain

block.name: network_information_serivice_servers_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of IP addresses indicating NIS+ servers available to the client

block.name: mobile_ip_home_agent_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of IP addresses indicating mobile IP home agents available to the client

block.name: smtp_server_option
block.description: The SMTP server option specifies a list of SMTP servers available to the client

block.name: pop3_server_option
block.description: The POP3 server option specifies a list of POP3 available to the client

block.name: nntp_server_option
block.description: The NNTP server option specifies a list of NNTP available to the client

block.name: default_www_server_option
block.description: The WWW server option specifies a list of WWW available to the client

block.name: default_finger_server_option
block.description: The Finger server option specifies a list of Finger available to the client

block.name: default_irc_server_option
block.description: The IRC server option specifies a list of IRC available to the client

block.name: streettalk_server_option
block.description: The StreetTalk server option specifies a list of StreetTalk servers available to the client

block.name: stda_server_option
block.description: The StreetTalk Directory Assistance (STDA) server option specifies a list of STDA servers available to the client

block.name: requested_ip_address_option
block.description: This option is used in a client request (DHCPDISCOVER) to allow the client to request that a particular IP address be assigned

block.name: ip_address_lease_time_option
block.description: This option is used in a client request (DHCPDISCOVER or DHCPREQUEST) to allow the client to request a lease time for the IP address

field.name: time
field.description: The time is in units of seconds

block.name: overload_option
block.description: This option is used to indicate that the DHCP 'sname' or 'file' fields are being overloaded by using them to carry DHCP options

block.name: tftp_server_name_option
block.description: This option is used to identify a TFTP server when the 'sname' field in the DHCP header has been used for DHCP options

block.name: bootfile_name_option
block.description: This option is used to identify a bootfile when the 'file' field in the DHCP header has been used for DHCP options

block.name: dhcp_message_type_option
block.description: This option is used to convey the type of the DHCP message

block.name: server_identifier_option
block.description: This option is used in DHCPOFFER and DHCPREQUEST messages, and may optionally be included in the DHCPACK and DHCPNAK messages

block.name: parameter_request_list_option
block.description: This option is used by a DHCP client to request values for specified configuration parameters

block.name: option_codes
block.description: List of Requested Option

block.name: message_option
block.description: This option is used by a DHCP server to provide an error message to a DHCP client in a DHCPNAK message in the event of a failure

block.name: maximum_dhcp_message_size_option
block.description: This option specifies the maximum length DHCP message that it is willing to accept

block.name: renewal_time_value_option
block.description: This option specifies the time interval from address assignment until the client transitions to the RENEWING state

field.name: t1
field.description: The time is in units of seconds

block.name: rebinding_time_value_option
block.description: This option specifies the time interval from address assignment until the client transitions to the REBINDING state

field.name: t2
field.description: The time is in units of seconds

block.name: vendor_class_identifier_option
block.description: This option is used by DHCP clients to optionally identify the vendor type and configuration of a DHCP client

block.name: client_identifier_option
block.description: This option is used by DHCP clients to specify their unique identifier

block.name: nds_server_option
block.description: This option specifies one or more NDS servers for the client to contact for access to the NDS database

block.name: nds_tree_name_option
block.description: This option specifies the name of the NDS tree the client will be ontacting

block.name: user_authentication_protocol_option
block.description: This option specifies a list of URLs, each pointing to a user authentication service that is capable of processing authentication requests encapsulated in the User Authentication Protocol (UAP)

field.name: url_list
field.description: Separed by the ASCII space character (0x20)

block.name: private_use_option
block.description: Private use option

block.name: auto_configure_option
block.description: This option code is used to ask whether, and be notified if, auto-configuration should be disabled on the local subnet

block.name: subnet_selection_option
block.description: The option contains a single IPv4 address that is the address of a subnet

block.name: netware_ip_domain_name_option
block.description: This option code is used to convey the NetWare/IP domain name used by the NetWare/IP product

block.name: the_netware_ip_information_option
block.description: The NetWare/IP option code will be used to convey all the NetWare/IP related information except for the NetWare/IP domain name

field.name: nwip_does_not_exist
field.description: The responding DHCP server does not have any NetWare/IP information configured

field.name: nwip_exist_in_options_area
field.description: All NetWare/IP information is present in the 'options' area of the DHCP response packet

field.name: nwip_exist_in_sname_file
field.description: All NetWare/IP information is present in the 'sname' and, if necessary, 'file' fields of the DHCP response packet

field.name: nwip_exist_but_too_big
field.description: Neither 'options' area nor 'sname' field can accommodate the NetWare/IP information

field.name: nsq_broadcast
field.description: If the value is 1, the client SHOULD perform a NetWare Nearest Server Query to find out its nearest NetWare/IP server

field.name: preferred_dss
field.description: The list contains the addresses of N NetWare Domain SAP/RIP Server (DSS)

field.name: nearest_nwip_server
field.description: The list contains the addresses of n Nearest NetWare/IP servers

field.name: autoretries
field.description: The value is a one byte integer value indicating the number of times a NetWare/IP client should attempt to communicate with a given DSS server at startup

field.name: autoretry_secs
field.description: The value is a one byte integer value indicating the amount of delay in seconds in between each NetWare/IP client attempt to communicate with a given DSS server at startup

field.name: nwip_1_1
field.description: If the value is 1, the NetWare/IP client SHOULD support NetWare/IP Version 1.1 compatibility

field.name: primary_dss
field.description: This field identifies the Primary Domain SAP/RIP Service server (DSS) for this NetWare/IP domain

block.name: user_class_option
block.description: This option is used by a DHCP client to optionally identify the type or category of user or applications it represents

block.name: slp_directory_agent_option
block.description: This option specifies the location of one or more SLP Directory Agents

block.name: slp_service_scope_option
block.description: The scope list is a comma delimited list which indicates the scopes that a SLP Agent is configured to use

block.name: client_fqdn_option
block.description: To update the IP address to FQDN mapping a DHCP server needs to know the FQDN of the client to which the server leases the address

field.name: MBZ
field.description: MUST BE ZERO (reserved for future use)

block.name: relay_agent_information_option
block.description: It is a 'container' option for specific agent=supplied sub=options

field.name: agent_circuit_id_sub_option
field.description: It encodes an agent-local identifier of the circuit from which a DHCP client-to-server packet was received

field.name: agent_remote_id_sub_option
field.description: This sub-option MAY be added by DHCP relay agents which terminate switched or permanent circuits and have mechanisms to identify the remote host end of the circuit

field.name: docsis_device_class_sub_option
field.description: The DOCSIS RFI specification specifies the Device Class encoding within the payload of the Device Class Identification Request (DCI-REQ) message

block.name: name_service_search_option
block.description: A DHCP server SHOULD return, in its preferred order, the 16-bit, network byte order (big-endian) integer option code for the name services (the earlier in the list, the more preferred the name service)

block.name: name_service_search_list
block.longname: Name Service Search Order in Sequence

block.name: sip_server_dhcp_option
block.description: The SIP server DHCP option carries either a 32-bit (binary) IPv4 address or, preferably, a DNS (RFC 1035) fully-qualified domain name to be used by the SIP client to locate a SIP server

block.name: authentication_option
block.description: The code for the authentication option is 90, and the length field contains the length of the protocol, RDM, algorithm, Replay Detection fields and authentication information fields in octets

field.name: protocol
field.description: The protocol field defines the particular technique for authentication used in the option

field.name: algorithm
field.description: The algorithm field defines the specific algorithm within the technique identified by the protocol field

field.name: rdm
field.description: The Replay Detection Method (RDM) field determines the type of replay detection used in the Replay Detection field

field.name: rd
field.description: The Replay Detection field is per the RDM, and the authentication information field is per the protocol in use

block.name: naming_authority_extension_option
block.description: This extension indicates a naming authority (which specifies the syntax for schemes that may be used in URLs) for use by entities with the Service Location Protocol

block.name: ieee_1003_1_posix_timezone_specifier_option
block.description: This NVT ASCII string represents the IEEE 1003.1 POSIX Timezone specification that a client is to use to set its timezone

block.name: agent_remote_id_option
block.description: This option MAY be added by DHCP relay agents which terminate switched or permanent circuits and have mechanisms to identify the remote host end of the circuit

case.show: Time Offset in seconds from UTC
Size of boot file in 512 byte chunks
Client to dump and name the file to dump it to
The DNS domain name of the client
Path name for more BOOTP info
Communication with destination network administratively prohibited
Communication with destination host administratively prohibited
Network unreachable for type of service
Host unreachable for type of service

default.show: Error in ICMP Destination Unreachable code lookup

case.show: Redirect datagrams for the Type of Service and Network
Redirect datagrams for the Type of Service and Host

default.show: Error in ICMP Redirect code lookup

protocol.name: arp
protocol.comment: This protocol has been 'hardwired' to IP. In fact, we do not know any other network protocol that uses ARP.

field.name: hlen
field.comment: The length is in multiple of 4 bytes

field.name: foffset
field.comment: This is in multiple of 8 bytes

field.name: len
field.comment: The value of this field must be 4

default.comment: Every compartment different from 0 is unknown

protocol.name: ipfrag
protocol.comment: Fake protocol, that contains the fragmented payload of an IPv4 packet

field.name: helen
field.longname: Length (multiple of 8 bytes, not including the first 8)

field.name: reserved
field.comment: This is in multiple of 8 bytes

field.name: helen
field.longname: Length (multiple of 8 bytes, not including the first 8)

field.name: hlen
field.comment: This is in multiple of 8 bytes

field.name: act
field.longname: Action (action if Option Type is unrecognized)

field.name: chg
field.longname: Change (whether or not option data can change while packet is en-route)

field.name: act
field.longname: Action (action if Option Type is unrecognized)

field.name: chg
field.longname: Change (whether or not option data can change while packet is en-route)

default.show: Error in IPv6 Option Type lookup

case.show: Discard packet and send ICMP if packet was unicast

default.show: Error in IPv6 Option Action lookup

case.show: Option data does not change en-route

default.show: Error in IPv6 Option Change lookup

case.show: Datagram contains a Multicast Listener Discovery message
Datagram contains an Active Networks message

default.show: Error in IPv6 Router Alert Option lookup

field.name: A
field.comment: Can be used as a prefix for interface auto-configuration

default.show: Error in ICMP6 NDO Type lookup

field.name: NameServerCount
field.longname: Number of name server resource records

field.name: rname
field.description: Mailbox of the person responsible for this zone

case.show: CNAME - Canonical name for an alias
SOA - Start of a zone of authority
MR - Mail rename domain name; experimental
MINFO - Mailbox or mail list information
AFXR - Request for a transfer of an entire zone
MAILA - Request for mail agent RRs;obsolete

field.name: hlen
field.comment: This field is in multiple of 4 bytes

field.name: padf
field.description: Field used to re-align the PDU to a word

field.name: endopt
field.description: Indicates the end of the option list

field.name: type
field.description: This option code may be used between options

field.name: shift.cnt
field.description: If window scaling is enabled the sender will right-shift its receive window values by 'shift.cnt'

field.name: mbz
field.description: The value of this field is 0

field.name: mbz3
field.description: The value of this field is 0

field.name: mbz4
field.description: The value of this field is 0

field.name: Metric
field.description: this is the path cost of forwarding

field.name: Route Tag
field.description: Is used by other routing protocols

field.name: Netmask
field.description: Is used to know the subnet adress

field.name: Metric
field.description: this is the path cost of forwarding

field.name: plen
field.description: The length of the OSPF protocol packet in bytes

field.name: rid
field.description: The Router ID of the packet's source

field.name: aid
field.description: A 32 bit number identifying the area that this packet belongs to

field.name: checksum
field.description: The standard IP checksum of the entire contents of the packet

field.name: auty
field.description: Identifies the authentication procedure to be used for the packet

field.name: Auth
field.description: A 64-bit field for use by the authentication scheme

field.name: netmask
field.description: The network mask associated with this interface

field.name: helloint
field.description: Time between the router's hello packets

block.name: opt
block.description: The optional capabilities supported by the router

field.name: RtrDeadInt
field.description: The number of seconds before declaring a silent router down

field.name: DesigRtr
field.description: The identity of the Designated Router for this network

field.name: BackDesRtr
field.description: The identity of the Backup Designated Router for this network

field.name: Neighbor
field.description: The Router IDs of each router from whom valid Hello packets have been seen recently on the network

field.name: intMTU
field.description: The size in bytes of the largest IP datagram that can be sent out the associated interface

field.name: DD
field.description: Used to sequence the collection of Database Description Packets

field.name: lsage
field.description: The time in seconds since the link state advertisement was originated

field.name: lstype
field.description: The type of the link state advertisement

field.name: lsid
field.description: Identifies the portion of the internet environment that is being described by the advertisement

field.name: advr
field.description: The Router ID of the router that originated the link state advertisement

field.name: lsseq
field.description: Detects old or duplicate link state advertisements

field.name: lschk
field.description: Fletcher checksum of the complete contents of the link state advertisement, including the link state advertisement header but excepting the LS age field

field.name: lslen
field.description: Length in bytes of the link state advertisement

field.name: reqlsid
field.description: This field identifies the portion of the internet environment that is being described by the LSA

field.name: reqadvr
field.description: The Router ID of the router that originated the LSA

field.name: nLSAs
field.description: The number of LSAs included in this update

field.name: metric
field.description: The cost of using this outbound router link, for traffic of the specified TOS

field.name: attachedr
field.description: The Router IDs of each of the routers attached to the network

field.name: forwardaddr
field.description: Data traffic for the advertised destination will be forwarded to this address

field.name: ertag
field.description: A 32-bit field attached to each external route

case.show: Summary Link to an IP Network
Summary Link to a border router

Error in OSPF Link Type lookup

protocol.name: ospf6
protocol.longname: OSPFv6 (Open Shortest Path First for IPv6)

block.name: options1
block.longname: Optional capabilities supported by the router

block.name: options2
block.longname: Optional capabilities supported by the router

block.name: options1
block.longname: optional capabilities supported by the router

block.name: options2
block.longname: optional capabilities supported by the router

block.name: ocsr
block.longname: optional capabilities supported by the router

field.name: option1
field.longname: optional capabilities supported by the router (reserved)

block.name: options2
block.longname: optional capabilities supported by the router (valid)

field.name: paO
field.description: It defines whether the attribute is optional (if set to 1) or well-known (if set to 0)

field.name: paT
field.description: It defines whether an optional attribute is transitive (if set to 1) or non-transitive (if set to 0)

field.name: paP
field.description: It defines whether the information contained in the optional transitive attribute is partial (if set to 1) or complete (if set to 0)

field.name: paE
field.description: It defines whether the Attribute Length is one octet (if set to 0) or two octets (if set to 1)

field.name: pau
field.longname: Path Attributes Flags unused or well-known (if set to 0)

case.show: IGP - Network Layer Reachability Information is interior to the originating AS
EGP - Network Layer Reachability Information learned via EGP
INCOMPLETE - Network Layer Reachability Information learned by some other means
AS Set - unordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed
AS_SEQUENCE - ordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed

field.name: value
field.longname: Bit6: Split Horizon concealed route; Bit7: Destination unreachable

field.name: Metric
field.description: The cost metric of the unicast route to the source

field.name: PrefixCnt
field.description: number of encoded group addresses included in the message

field.name: Holdtime
field.description: amount of time the advertisement is valid

field.name: Metric
field.description: The cost metric of the unicast route to the source

field.name: Masklen
field.description: length of the address mask of the unicast route to the source

field.name: TTL
field.description: Time To Live of the State Refresh message

field.name: Interval
field.description: seconds between consecutive State Refresh messages

protocol.name: pim6

field.name: Metric
field.description: The cost metric of the unicast route to the source

block.name: PimCandidateRPAdvertisementv6
block.longname: PIM Candidate RP Advertisement Message ipv6

field.name: PrefixCnt
field.description: number of encoded group addresses included in the message

field.name: Holdtime
field.description: amount of time the advertisement is valid

field.name: Metric
field.description: The cost metric of the unicast route to the source

field.name: Masklen
field.description: length of the address mask of the unicast route to the source

field.name: TTL
field.description: Time To Live of the State Refresh message

field.name: Interval
field.description: seconds between consecutive State Refresh messages

case.show: Passes the IOCTL to the server
Session Set Up and X (including User Logon)
Only Two Way Transaction is possible
Don't permit reads if execute only

Message is a Response to Server
The Read and Write Lock is not supported
The Read and Write Lock is supported

block.name: applianceid
block.description: Allows the VoIP traffic to be differentiated from other traffic, as by separate VLAN-id (auxiliary VLAN)

default.show: Error in CDP commands code lookup

field.name: helloTime
field.description: Seconds between two Hello messages (Used only in Hello messages)

field.name: holdTime
field.description: Time that the current Hello message should be considered valid (used only in Hello messages)

field.name: group
field.description: For Token Ring, values between 0 and 2 inclusive are valid. For other media values between 0 and 255 inclusive are valid.

case.show: Hello Message: router is running and is capable of becoming the active or standby router
Coup Message: router wishes to become the active router
Resign Message: router no longer wishes to be the active router
Advertise Message: initial message sent by the router, but not documented in RFC
Init: HSRP is not running, bootstrap or configuration change
Learn: HSRP is running but the router does not know the virtual IP Address
Listen: the router knows the virtual IP address, but is neither the active router nor the standby router
Speak: the router is participating in the election of the active and/or standby router
Standby: the router is the Standby router
Active: the router is the Active router

default.show: Error in HSRP State code lookup

field.name: type
field.comment: For this version the only type defined is ADVERTISEMENT (value = 1)

field.name: adverInt
field.comment: This field is used for troubleshooting misconfigured routers

field.name: checksum
field.description: 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the entire VRRP message starting with the version field

case.show: No Authentication: AuthData SHOULD be zero filled
Simple Text Password: AuthData contain clear text password (this one in the end MUST be zero filled)
IP Authentication Header: The packet is authenticated with HMAC-MD5-96, AuthData SHOULD be zero filled

default.show: Error in VRRP Authentication Type lookup

case.show: PPP for Data Compression in Data Circuit-Terminating Equipment

if.expr: buf2int(code) == 9 or buf2int(code) == 10 or buf2int(code) == 11 or buf2int(code) == 12

case.show: Multilink Short Sequence Number Header Format
General error: Error Code indicates the problem
Requester is not authorized to establish a command channel
The protocol version of the requester is not supported
The protocol version of the requester is not supported
(General Error) - Control connection not closed for reason indicated in Error Code
(General Error) - Echo-Request not accepted for the reason indicated in Error Code
Call to be placed on an analog channel
Call to be placed on a digital channel
Call to be placed on any type of channel
Call can use either type of framing
General Error) - Outgoing Call not established for the reason indicated in Error Code
(No Carrier) - Outgoing Call failed due to no carrier detected
(Busy) - Outgoing Call failed due to detection of a busy signal
(Busy) - (No Dial Tone) - Outgoing Call failed due to lack of a dial tone
(Time-out) - Outgoing Call was not established within time allotted by PAC
Call is on an analog channel
Call is on a digital channel
(Connect) - The PAC should answer the incoming call
(General Error) - The Incoming Call should not be established due to the reason indicated in Error Code
(Do Not Accept) - The PAC should not accept the incoming call. It should hang up or issue a busy indication
